reason: There is a type-level confusion in the notation. h_3 is defined as a permutation on elements (presumably integers 1-6), yet the proof applies h_3 to both elements (h_3(1)=1) and to sets (h_3({1,4})={1,4}). These are different types of objects. Formally, we have h_3: X -> X and an induced map h_3*: P(X) -> P(X) defined by h_3*(S) = {h_3(x) : x in S}. The proof uses h_3 for both without distinguishing between the permutation and its induced action on the power set. This conflation, while common in informal mathematics, is a type error in a rigorous treatment.
